tweets.text:
In 2019 over 1,500,000 hours worth of sewage was dumped into our rivers.

2020 every single river in England is polluted, NONE meet ‚ÄòGood‚Äô overall environmental status.
 
Meanwhile @EnvAgency‚Äôs CEO makes a speech about the NHS.

Fiddling while Rome burns.

https://t.co/ylCeEQVypm

tweets.text:
Ok
1. Pass Environment Bill ASAP & establish legally binding targets
2. Establish Office of Environmental Responsibility to hold Govt to account
3. Ensure new land management  subsidies support farmers deliver for wildlife 
4. Bolster @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency to enforce law https://t.co/hNvO3w0TM7

It‚Äôs a packed agenda tonight - from sources of #flooding & communicating risk to awareness of hazards & the necessary steps to keep Wardens & the #community safe. Great to see so many people in attendance üòä #CPYorks @EnvAgencyYNE @SimonHildonEA https://t.co/MLSBoDa5BA

Great progress being made on the ¬£30m Burton-upon-Trent #flood defence scheme which is due for completion next spring. Sections will be finished progressively and made accessible to the public. Pics show embankment near golf course and Fairway estate. https://t.co/DEE7cugfl4

We continue to be outraged that work to destroy ancient woodland and irreplaceable habitats at Little Lynton and Fulfen Woods in the county have already started, despite assurances from #HS2 this would not happen. @HS2ltd 
Sites like this should be protected from this devastation https://t.co/d969nUhy2d

A completed scrape settling in nicely from earlier in the year. 
Nice little #nfm project with @EnvAgencyNW 
Works for flood water storage, massive bio diversity boost for the area and provides livestock drinking source in drought conditions.
Partnership working at its best https://t.co/Ah4LzxoWQf
@sixdegreesofcb @EnvAgency Hello Christopher, thanks for getting in touch. This has been reported to the regional team so that they can get this all sorted. Best wishes, Rachael

Don't forget to sign up to @EnvAgencyNW flood warnings if you live in a #floodrisk area!

https://t.co/GMJTmgX4Z5

#flooding #Floodaware #preparedness https://t.co/CA8dl677Hc

Our #NorthEast Field Team responded quickly to a report of a fallen tree in the #River Browney at Stonebridge near #Durham city which was increasing #flood risk in the area. They used a chainsaw and winch to remove the tree and reduce flood risk. https://t.co/99rJstZIuc
.@EnvAgencySW has published a report on the quality of #Somerset's rivers - and it's not looking at all good: https://t.co/lTdoNr8nsH #LDReporter

We‚Äôre working hard to keep our fleet of operational vehicles safe for our drivers so we are ready to respond to incidents of #flooding and environmental #pollution around the clock. #plan #prepare #respond #cat1responders #TeamEA https://t.co/fFwGjB6aiX

We‚Äôve been notified by @LRT of cases of #MittenCrabs in the #Lune estuary. Mitten Crabs can harm river embankments & native species. 

Please remember to check, clean & dry to reduce the spread of invasive species.

To report sightings & for more info: https://t.co/3PnEARbPp0 https://t.co/pfYAdVdo1p

tweets.text:
Day 51

The next environmental ticking time bomb will be toxic and dangerous #PFAS and #PFOS chemicals in UK waters.

A regulatory vacuum.

When will this be reported? 

 @EnvAgency @DefraWater @GeorgeMonbiot @carolecadwalla @BBCNews @Channel4News @jonsnowC4 @EnvAgencyYNE
Such an out dated approach by @EnvAgency . Water sports are booming, wetsuit sales through the roof. We moved on from Victorian times... https://t.co/4mjVlOBwuB

#Fish of the Severn Estuary are under threat. Thousands of fish will die in the double-decker sized cooling tunnels at Hinkley Point C. @EnvAgency @CefasGovUK @The_MMO please make the right decision and make sure an AFD is installed, as the DCO states. #SaveSevernsFish

Read the incredible story of how @AquaUoS @SalfordScience helped restore the River Keekle in Cumbria in partnership with @EnvAgency. The plastic was removed and #recycled.  Click ‚¨áÔ∏è
https://t.co/yrk19bV2n5

#plasticpollution #riverestoration #SalfordHydro https://t.co/lDndXM9Gwk

We‚Äôve committed to protect 30% of the UK's land and ocean by 2030.

Biodiversity loss is occurring at an alarming rate, with more than 32,000 species threatened with extinction.

It‚Äôs time to act.

Find out more here: https://t.co/esoblXJavS

#30by30 #UNGA #Leaders4Nature https://t.co/3e4fxLhMOz
